bio:
Jung Hyun Moon is Clinical Instructor of Arts at NYU Shanghai. He holds a MPS from Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP) at New York University (NYU).

J.H Moon, an interaction designer and creative coder, creates interdisciplinary work in new media. He’s known for his work, both experimental and mainstream, in the visual and performing arts. Moon is particularly known for his innovative use of lighting and dance in close collaboration with choreographers and dancers.

His productions have been exhibited most recently at the NASA Space App Event and Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM) in New York City, as well as some of the most prestigious museums in Korea. He was a creative technologist at BREAKFAST and research resident with the Tisch School of the Arts Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP), where he received his Masters degree in 2015.
